data.title: Morrissey Announces North American Tour in Fall 2024
data.meta_description: Morrissey will kick off a 2024 tour of the US and Canada this fall, according to a new press release from the English singer/songwriter.
data.text:
Morrissey has just announced a brief tour of the United States and Canada this fall! The announcement follows Morrissey’s recent four-date residency in Las Vegas, Nevada. The trek will take the English singer/songwriter across the US south and East Coast as well as Ontario, Canada. As of this posting, it doesn’t look like any supporting acts have been announced other than Morrissey’s band.

According to Morrissey’s longtime guitarist Jesse Tobias, this tour is going to be something particularly special for fans.

Videos by American Songwriter

“There is currently something happening, a finesse and ferocity coming from Morrissey and the band that is unparalleled to anything I’ve seen in my tenure as Morrissey’s guitarist for over 21 years,” said Tobias in a press release for the tour.

The Morrissey 2024 Tour will kick off on October 31 in Houston, Texas at 713 Music Hall. Pending any additional tour dates that could be added in the coming weeks, the trek should come to an end on November 23 in Waukegan, Illinois at the Genesee Theatre.

Tickets to the Morrissey 2024 Tour will be available on Ticketmaster and a presale event is currently underway. General on-sale will begin on Friday, August 9 at 10:00 am local.

If you didn’t get the chance to get a code or tickets during the presale event, you might have some luck on Stubhub. We recommend Stubhub for after-sale tickets, especially for tour dates that have since been sold out. If you can’t find tickets to your preferred tour date on Ticketmaster, give Stubhub a try.

Get your tickets ASAP before they’re totally gone! This is a pretty short tour that will likely sell out quickly. And who knows when Morrissey will hit the States again?

October 31 – Houston, TX – 713 Music Hall

November 2 – Dallas, TX – Music Hall at Fair Park

November 4 – Little Rock, AR – Robinson Center

November 6 – Birmingham, AL – Alabama Theatre

November 7 – Knoxville, TN – Tennessee Theatre

November 9 – Durham, NC – Durham Performing Arts Center

November 12 – Baltimore, MD – The Lyric Baltimore

November 13 – Newark, NJ – Performing Arts Center

November 15 – Atlantic City, NJ – Ocean Resort

November 16 – Rochester, NY – Kodak Center

November 19 – Niagara Falls, ON – Fallsview Resort

November 20 – Flint, MI – Capitol Theater

November 22 – Indianapolis, IN – Murat Theatre

November 23 – Waukegan, IL – Genesee Theatre

Photo by Jim Dyson

When you purchase through links on our site, we may earn an affiliate commission.
